5.question: Which of the following properties of probability is not valid?
choices: The probability of an event is always positive and less than or equal to one.
If E<sub>0</sub> is an event which cannot occur in the sample space, the probability of E<sub>0</sub> is zero.
If events E<sub>1</sub> and E<sub>2</sub> are mutually exclusive, then the probability of both events occurring is zero.
If events E<sub>1</sub> and E<sub>2</sub> are events from the same sample space, then P(E<sub>1</sub> + E<sub>2</sub>) = P(E<sub>1</sub>) + P(E<sub>2</sub>) ‚Äì P(E<sub>1</sub>E<sub>2</sub>).
